#labels Featured,Phase-Implementation,Phase-Deploy
== Chart examples adapted from the Google examples taken from the wrapper module unit tests ==
=== Simple ===
{{{
# Instantiate the GChart instance, this is all you will need for making charts
# GChart(type=None, dataset=None), see the doc for more
G = GChart()
# Set the chart type, either Google API type or regular name
G.type('pie')
# Update the chart's dataset, can be two dimensional and contain string data
G.dataset( 'helloworld' )
# Set the size of the chart, default is 300x150
G.size(250,100)
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=e:helloworld&chs=250x100&cht=p&.png

=== Title ===
{{{
# Title using name with optional color and size
G = Line( ['GurMrabsClgubaolGvzCrgrefOrnhgvshyvforggregunahtyl'] )
G.title('The Zen of Python','00cc00',36)
G.color('00cc00')
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=e:GurMrabsClgubaolGvzCrgrefOrnhgvshyvforggregunahtyl&chco=00cc00&chts=00cc00,36&chs=300x150&cht=lc&chtt=The+Zen+of+Python&.png

=== Line ===
{{{
# Add red line 6 thick
# with 5 line segments with 2 blank segments
G = Line( ['hX1xPj'] )
G.axes.type('xy')
G.axes.label('Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'June', 'July')
G.axes.label(None, '50+Kb')
G.color('ff0000')
G.line(6,5,2)
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chxt=x,y&chd=e:hX1xPj&chco=ff0000&chs=300x150&cht=lc&chxl=0:|Mar|Apr|May|June|July|1:||50+Kb&chls=6.0,5.0,2.0&.png

=== Multiline ===
{{{
# Draw multiple lines with markers on an lxy chart
G = LineXY( [
[0,30,60,70,90,95,100], # x values
[20,30,40,50,60,70,80], # y values, etc.
[10,30,40,45,52],
[100,90,40,20,10],
[-1], # domain not found, interpolated
[5,33,50,55,7],
], scale=100) # scale the data to the maximum
G.color('3072F3','ff0000','00aaaa')
G.marker('s','FF0000',0,-1,5)
G.marker('s','0000ff',1,-1,5)
G.marker('s','00aa00',2,-1,5)
G.line(2,4,1)
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=e:AATNmZsz5m8y..,MzTNZmgAmZszzM,GaTNZmczhR,..5mZmMzGa,,DNVHgAjMEf&chco=3072F3,ff0000,00aaaa&chm=s,FF0000,0,-1,5|s,0000ff,1,-1,5|s,00aa00,2,-1,5&chs=300x150&cht=lxy&chls=2.0,4.0,1.0&.png

=== Bar ===
{{{
# 2 color horizontal bars 10 wide
# with 5 spacing between bars in group and 10 between groups
G = HorizontalBarGroup( ['hell','orld'] )
G.color('cc0000', '00aa00')
G.bar(10,5,10)
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chs=300x150&chd=e:hell,orld&chco=cc0000,00aa00&cht=bhg&chbh=10.0,5.0,10.0&.png

=== Pie ===
{{{
# Simple pie chart based on range
G = Pie3D( [1,2,3,4] )
G.label('A','B','C','D')
G.color('00dd00')
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chl=A|B|C|D&chs=300x150&chco=00dd00&cht=p3&chd=e:ABACADAE&.png

=== Venn ===
{{{
# Extended venn diagram based on int list, scale the data to the max value
G = Venn( [100,80,60,30,30,30,10] )
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=e:BkBQA8AeAeAeAK&chs=300x150&cht=v&.png

=== Axes ===
{{{
# Call type first with the chxt
# then call label and style in order,
# label can contain None(s)
G = Line( ['foobarbaz'] )
G.color('76A4FB')
G.axes.type('xyrx')
G.axes.label('Foo', 'Bar', 'Baz')
G.axes.label(None, '20K', '60K', '100K')
G.axes.label('A', 'B', 'C')
G.axes.label(None,'20','40','60','80')
G.axes.style('0000dd', 14)
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chxt=x,y,r,x&chd=e:foobarbaz&chxs=0,0000dd,14&chco=76A4FB&chs=300x150&cht=lc&chxl=0:|Foo|Bar|Baz|1:||20K|60K|100K|2:|A|B|C|3:||20|40|60|80&.png

=== Grid ===
{{{
# Create dashed line with grid x,y as floats
# then, just like line, the line and blank segments
G = Line( ['foobarbaz'] )
G.color('76A4FB')
G.line(3,6,3)
G.grid(20.0,25.0,1,0)
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=e:foobarbaz&chg=20.0,25.0,1.0,0.0&chco=76A4FB&chs=300x150&cht=lc&chls=3.0,6.0,3.0&.png

=== Markers ===
{{{
# Mark up some of the data randomly
G = Line( ['helloWorld'] )
G.marker('c','ff0000',0,3,20)
G.marker('d','00ff00',0,6,15)
G.marker('a','000099',0,4,10)
G.marker('R','A0BAE9',0,8,0.6)
G.marker('r','E5ECF9',0,1,0.25)
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=e:helloWorld&chs=300x150&cht=lc&chm=c,ff0000,0,3,20|d,00ff00,0,6,15|a,000099,0,4,10|R,A0BAE9,0,8,0.6|r,E5ECF9,0,1,0.25&.png

=== Fill ===
{{{
# Fill the chart/background using chf, add axes to show bg
G = Line( ['pqokeYONOMEBAKPOQVTXZdecaZcglprqxuux393ztpoonkeggjp'] )
G.color('ff0000')
G.line(4,3,0)
G.axes.type('xy')
G.axes.label(1,2,3,4,5)
G.axes.label(None,50,100)
G.fill('c','lg',45,'ffffff',0,'76A4FB',0.75)
G.fill('bg','s','EFEFEF')
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chxt=x,y&chd=e:pqokeYONOMEBAKPOQVTXZdecaZcglprqxuux393ztpoonkeggjp&chf=c,lg,45,ffffff,0,76A4FB,0.75|bg,s,EFEFEF&chco=ff0000&chs=300x150&cht=lc&chxl=0:|1|2|3|4|5|1:||50|100&chls=4.0,3.0,0.0&.png

=== Legend ===
{{{
# Add legend to the data set which follows collors
G = Line( ['FOETHECat','leafgreen','IRON4YOUs'] )
G.color('ff0000','00ff00','0000ff')
G.legend('Animals','Vegetables','Minerals')
G.axes.type('y')
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chxt=y&chd=e:FOETHECat,leafgreen,IRON4YOUs&chco=ff0000,00ff00,0000ff&chs=300x150&cht=lc&chdl=Animals|Vegetables|Minerals&.png

=== Hvz ===
{{{
# Make a vertical bar group and scale it to the max
G = VerticalBarGroup( [[31],[59],[4]] )
G.scale(59)
G.color('00ff00','ff0000','0000ff')
G.legend('Goucher(31)','Truman(59)','Kansas(4)')
G.fill('c','lg',45,'cccccc',0,'000000',1)
G.fill('bg','s','cccccc')
G.size(200,100)
}}}
http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=e:ho,..,EW&chf=c,lg,45,cccccc,0,000000,1|bg,s,cccccc&chco=00ff00,ff0000,0000ff&chs=200x100&cht=bvg&chdl=Goucher(31)|Truman(59)|Kansas(4)&.png
